aboutMe.bio: <Typography>I'm Lukas, 31 years old and a passionate software developer and tech enthusiast. Since completing my dual degree as a Mathematical-Technical Software Developer (MATSE) with a Bachelor in Applied Mathematics and Computer Science (B.Sc.), I’ve been working at KST Moschkau GmbH as a software developer.</Typography><Typography>My main focus is frontend development, particularly building modern web applications with React, Next.js, and TypeScript. I also have experience in backend development, gained through university projects, personal projects, and professional work. Currently, I’m working on small microcontroller projects, which allows me to develop software not only in the browser but also closer to the hardware.</Typography><Typography>In my free time, I explore all kinds of tech beyond software development. From home automation with a small home server, Home Assistant, and various modules and switches, to hosting local services like paperless-ngx, Tandoor, or Actual, and even 3D printing. I am also a sport addict and enjoy spending time in nature.</Typography>

adminShell.title: adesso SE - Admin Shell
adminShell.description: The Admin Shell is the software project I worked on the most during my time at adesso SE. It is the frontend for displaying and managing data from the Identity Manager, Session Manager and Audittrail services. At the time of my employment, the admin shell written in Angular was to be completely rebuilt in React and Next.js. I supported the senior developers and was able to help design the new application.

myBattlefieldLobby.title: My Battlefield Lobby
myBattlefieldLobby.description: My Battlefield Lobby is a hobby project that was born out of a passion for the Battlefield series. With the help of the open REST API https://api.gametools.network, I have created a website that allows you to find your current game lobby and display the data of your fellow players. This allows you to quickly check whether a teammate or opponent is an obvious cheater. The application is hosted as an Azure Static Web App as a free plan.

trashTracker.title: Trash Tracker
trashTracker.description: The Trash Tracker app is used to locate littered places around the world and mark them on a map. This gives hard-working helpers the opportunity to visit these places, collect the waste and remove the marker from the map.  I had the idea for the Trash Tracker app for some time. The first prototype was realised as part of an Android course at university. Using a small .NET web api as a backend, an Android app was written that enables basic functions such as adding markers with descriptions and images and completing these tasks. Additionally, a simple authentication with .NET was integrated. Open Street Map was used for the map.

timeTracker.title: Veda - Time Tracker
timeTracker.description: VEDA used a time tracker from the Tempo plugin for its time recording in Jira. After the update to a new Jira version, however, this was no longer compatible and this resulted in the task of our university project. We wrote a desktop app for VEDA that is platform-independent and automates time tracking. The app allows users to log in with their Jira credentials using basic authentication, search and filter their tickets, track times for a selected ticket and then automatically create a work log in Jira.

keyerControlPanel.title: KST Moschkau GmbH - Keyer Control Panel
keyerControlPanel.description: <Typography>The Keyer Control Panel is a module specifically developed by KST Moschkau GmbH to functionally extend the software used in studio operations by Zero Density. It provides a web-based interface that allows staff to configure the key required in virtual studios to isolate objects form the greenscreen background. The isolated objects can then be integrated into a virtual environment. A well-known use case is weather presenters standing in front of a green background, while the visual content is added digitally afterward.</Typography><Typography>From a technical perspective, the Keyer Control Panel is a Node.js module for the RealityHub. It accesses the core keyer functionality via WebSocket and REST API interfaces and encapsulates it within its own module, ensuring that staff can access only the functions they need. In addition, the Keyer Control Panel enables the integration of a hardware panel for convenient adjustment of the values.</Typography><Typography>The RealityHub is part of Zero Density's RealityEngine and serves as the central interface between the Unreal Engine and the actual studio operations, making it essential for the implementation of a virtual Studio.</Typography>

redsecLegends.title: Redsec Legends
redsecLegends.description: Redsec Legends is a website I developed for our group of friends. It uses the open REST API provided by gametools.network (https://api.gametools.network) to retrieve real-time statistics from the Battle Royale mode of Battlefield 6. The collected data is clearly presented in the form of a small leaderboard, allowing us to see at any time who is currently in the lead.

contact.sendError: Error, please try resubmitting the form
contact.sendRateLimitError: Too many requests. Please try again later.

content.title: 1. limitation of liability for website content
content.paragraph1: The person responsible for the aforementioned website accepts no liability for the topicality, correctness and completeness of the content provided on this website. This does not apply if the person responsible can be accused of intentional or grossly negligent behavior. The contents were created with the greatest possible care and to the best of our knowledge. Nevertheless, the accuracy of the content cannot be guaranteed, especially in the case of complex topics, so that the person responsible recommends that users contact the relevant authorities for important information or seek legal advice.
content.paragraph2: Contributions identified by name that are made publicly available on the website reflect the opinion of the respective author and not always the opinion of the website operator.
content.paragraph3: Insofar as paid or free and freely accessible content or services are made available on the website, these are non-binding invitatio ad offerendum, which merely call for the submission of an offer by the user and do not themselves constitute a binding offer.
content.paragraph4: According to §§ 7 ff. DDG, the website operator is outside of the exceptions namend by law not responsible for third-party content that he publishes for a user, provided that
content.paragraph5: 1. he has no knowledge of the illegal act or the information and, in the case of claims for damages, no facts or circumstances are known to him from which the illegal act or the information becomes apparent, or
content.paragraph6: 2. he has taken immediate action to remove the information or to block access to it as soon as he became aware of it.
content.paragraph7: Liability in this regard is thus only possible from the time of gaining knowledge of a concrete infringement.
content.paragraph8: If the website operator becomes aware of such illegal content, it will be removed immediately.

links.title: 2. liability for outgoing links
links.paragraph1: The website operator links from his website to external websites. These so-called „hyperlinks“ lead the user directly to the external website. The setting of so-called „hyperlinks“ does not mean that the website operator adopts the content behind the link as its own. The website operator has no influence whatsoever on the information on the external website. Therefore, no liability can be assumed for the topicality, correctness and completeness of the contents of the external website.
links.paragraph2: The respective provider or operator of the linked website is solely responsible for the content.
links.paragraph3: However, the website operator assures that he was not aware of any legal violations at the time of setting the link and that he has checked the external website within the scope of what is reasonable.
links.paragraph4: As long as there are no concrete indications of a violation of the law, a permanent control of the linked website is not reasonable for the website operator.
links.paragraph5: If the website operator becomes aware of the illegality of the linked content, the corresponding link will be removed immediately.

copyright.title: 3. copyrights
copyright.paragraph1: The content published on this website is subject to German copyright and ancillary copyright law.
copyright.paragraph2: As the author within the meaning of Section 7 of the German Copyright Act (UrhG), the website operator is entitled to the sole and exclusive exploitation rights pursuant to Sections 15 et seq. UrhG. Any duplication or use of objects such as images, diagrams, sounds or texts in other electronic or printed publications is not permitted without the author’s agreement and will be prosecuted.
copyright.paragraph3: Contents that were not created by the website operator are marked as such. The copyrights of third parties are respected.
copyright.paragraph4: Should you nevertheless become aware of a copyright infringement, you are requested to notify the website operator accordingly. The website operator will then remove such content immediately.

privacyPolicy.title: 4. data protection
privacyPolicy.paragraph1: The website can generally be used without entering personal data such as name or e-mail address. No personal data will be stored.
privacyPolicy.paragraph2: Should the possibility of entering such data exist, the communication of this data is on a voluntary basis by the user. A transfer of this data to third parties without the express consent of the user is excluded.
privacyPolicy.paragraph3: However, complete protection of the transmitted data against access by unauthorized third parties is not possible, as there may be security gaps in the area of data transmission on the Internet. However, the website operator attempts to prevent the risk of unauthorized access by taking appropriate measures and, if it becomes aware of a security breach, to close it by taking appropriate measures.
privacyPolicy.paragraph4: The website operator does not assume any liability for damages caused by such security breaches.
privacyPolicy.paragraph5: When you visit the website, the website operator collects the data that is technically necessary to display the website to you and to ensure stability and security (IP address, date and time of request, browser, etc.). This collection of personal data does not constitute an evaluation of personal data.
privacyPolicy.paragraph6: The use of contact data published in the imprint by third parties for sending unsolicited advertisements, in particular spam e-mails, is prohibited and in case of non-compliance may be pursued with legal action.

responsibleAuthority.title: Designation of the Responsible Authority
responsibleAuthority.paragraph1: The responsible authority for data processing on this website is:
responsibleAuthority.author: Lukas Liebeck
responsibleAuthority.paragraph2: The responsible authority, either alone or jointly with others, decides on the purposes and means of processing personal data (e.g., names, contact details, etc.).

revocation.title: Revocation of Your Consent to Data Processing
revocation.paragraph1: Some data processing operations are only possible with your express consent. You can revoke your consent at any time. An informal notification via email is sufficient for revocation. The legality of the data processing carried out until the revocation remains unaffected by the revocation.

complaint.title: Right to Lodge a Complaint with the Competent Supervisory Authority
complaint.paragraph1: If there has been a breach of data protection law, you have the right to lodge a complaint with the competent supervisory authority. The competent supervisory authority for data protection issues is the data protection officer of the federal state in which our company is headquartered. The following link provides a list of data protection officers and their contact details:

dataPortability.title: Right to Data Portability
dataPortability.paragraph1: You have the right to have data that we process based on your consent or in fulfillment of a contract automatically handed over to yourself or to a third party. The data will be provided in a machine-readable format. If you request the direct transfer of the data to another responsible party, this will only be done to the extent that it is technically feasible.

information.title: Right of Information, Correction, Blocking, Deletion
information.paragraph1: Within the scope of the applicable legal provisions, you have the right at any time to obtain information free of charge about your stored personal data, its origin, its recipients, and the purpose of the data processing and, if applicable, a right to have this data corrected, blocked, or deleted. For this purpose, and for further questions on the subject of personal data, you can contact us at any time via the contact details provided in the legal notice.

encryption.title: SSL or TLS Encryption
encryption.paragraph1: For security reasons and to protect the transmission of confidential content that you send to us as the site operator, our website uses SSL or TLS encryption. This means that data you transmit via this website cannot be read by third parties. You can recognize an encrypted connection by the 'https://' address line of your browser and the lock icon in the browser line.

logs.title: Server Log Files
logs.paragraph1: The provider of the website automatically collects and stores information in server log files that your browser automatically transmits to us. These are:

data.date: Date and time of the server request
data.hostname: Host name of the accessing computer

logs.paragraph2: This data is technically necessary for us to display our website to you and to ensure stability and security. (The legal basis for data processing is Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR). This data is not merged with other data sources.

contactForm.title: Contact Form
contactForm.paragraph1: Data transmitted via the contact form, including your contact details, will be stored in order to process your request or to be available for follow-up questions. This data will not be passed on without your consent.
contactForm.paragraph2: Depending on the type of request, the legal basis for this processing is Art. 6 para. 1 lit. b DSGVO for requests that you make yourself as part of a pre-contractual measure or Art. 6 para. 1 sentence 1 lit. f DSGVO if your request is of a different nature. If personal data is requested that we do not need for the fulfilment of a contract or to protect legitimate interests, it will be transmitted to us on the basis of your consent in accordance with Art. 6 para. 1 lit. a DSGVO .t unaffected by the revocation.
contactForm.paragraph3: Data transmitted via the contact form will remain with us until you ask us to delete it, revoke your consent to storage or there is no longer any need to store the data. Mandatory statutory provisions - in particular retention periods - remain unaffected.
